classes.name: SnowflakeUtil
classes.description:
This class is an alias for {@link https://www.npmjs.com/package/@sapphire/snowflake @sapphire/snowflake}'s
`DiscordSnowflake` class.

Check their documentation
{@link https://www.sapphirejs.dev/docs/Documentation/api-utilities/classes/sapphire_snowflake.Snowflake here}
({@link https://www.sapphirejs.dev/docs/Guide/utilities/snowflake guide})
to see what you can do.

classes.name: Client
classes.description: The main hub for interacting with the Discord API, and the starting point for any bot.

params.name: options
params.description: Options for the client

props.name: ws
props.description: The WebSocket manager of the client

props.name: actions
props.description: The action manager of the client

props.name: voice
props.description: The voice manager of the client

props.name: shard
props.description: Shard helpers for the client (only if the process was spawned from a {@link ShardingManager})

props.name: users
props.description: All of the {@link User} objects that have been cached at any point, mapped by their ids

props.name: guilds
props.description:
All of the guilds the client is currently handling, mapped by their ids -
as long as sharding isn't being used, this will be *every* guild the bot is a member of

props.name: channels
props.description:
All of the {@link BaseChannel}s that the client is currently handling, mapped by their ids -
as long as sharding isn't being used, this will be *every* channel in *every* guild the bot
is a member of. Note that DM channels will not be initially cached, and thus not be present
in the Manager without their explicit fetching or use.

props.name: sweepers
props.description: The sweeping functions and their intervals used to periodically sweep caches

props.name: presence
props.description: The presence of the Client

props.name: token
props.description:
Authorization token for the logged in bot.
If present, this defaults to `process.env.DISCORD_TOKEN` when instantiating the client
<warn>This should be kept private at all times.</warn>

props.name: user
props.description: User that the client is logged in as

props.name: application
props.description: The application of this bot

props.name: readyTimestamp
props.description: Timestamp of the time the client was last {@link Status.Ready} at

props.name: emojis
props.description: All custom emojis that the client has access to, mapped by their ids

props.name: readyAt
props.description:
Time at which the client was last regarded as being in the {@link Status.Ready} state
(each time the client disconnects and successfully reconnects, this will be overwritten)

props.name: uptime
props.description: How long it has been since the client last entered the {@link Status.Ready} state in milliseconds

props.name: _censoredToken
props.description: Partially censored client token for debug logging purposes.

props.name: options
props.description: The options the client was instantiated with

props.name: rest
props.description: The REST manager of the client

methods.name: login
methods.description: Logs the client in, establishing a WebSocket connection to Discord.
examples: client.login('my token');

params.name: token
params.description: Token of the account to log in with

returns.description: Token of the account used

methods.name: isReady
methods.description:
Returns whether the client has logged in, indicative of being able to access
properties such as `user` and `application`.

methods.name: destroy
methods.description: Logs out, terminates the connection to Discord, and destroys the client.

methods.name: fetchInvite
methods.description: Obtains an invite from Discord.

params.name: invite
params.description: Invite code or URL

params.name: options
params.description: Options for fetching the invite

methods.name: fetchGuildTemplate
methods.description: Obtains a template from Discord.

params.name: template
params.description: Template code or URL

methods.name: fetchWebhook
methods.description: Obtains a webhook from Discord.

params.name: id
params.description: The webhook's id

params.name: token
params.description: Token for the webhook

methods.name: fetchVoiceRegions
methods.description: Obtains the available voice regions from Discord.

methods.name: fetchSticker
methods.description: Obtains a sticker from Discord.

params.name: id
params.description: The sticker's id

methods.name: fetchStickerPacks
methods.description: Obtains the list of available sticker packs.

params.name: options
params.description: Options for fetching sticker packs

returns.description: A collection of sticker packs, or a single sticker pack if a packId was provided

methods.name: fetchPremiumStickerPacks
methods.description: Obtains the list of available sticker packs.
methods.deprecated: Use {@link Client#fetchStickerPacks} instead.

methods.name: fetchGuildPreview
methods.description: Obtains a guild preview from Discord, available for all guilds the bot is in and all Discoverable guilds.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild to fetch the preview for

methods.name: fetchGuildWidget
methods.description: Obtains the widget data of a guild from Discord, available for guilds with the widget enabled.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild to fetch the widget data for

methods.name: generateInvite
methods.description: Generates a link that can be used to invite the bot to a guild.

params.name: options
params.description: Options for the invite

methods.name: _eval
methods.description:
Calls {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/eval} on a script
with the client as `this`.

params.name: script
params.description: Script to eval

methods.name: _validateOptions
methods.description: Validates the client options.

params.name: options
params.description: Options to validate

methods.name: deleteWebhook
methods.description: Deletes a webhook.

params.name: id
params.description: The webhook's id

params.name: options
params.description: Options for deleting the webhook

methods.name: incrementMaxListeners
methods.description: Increments max listeners by one, if they are not zero.

methods.name: decrementMaxListeners
methods.description: Decrements max listeners by one, if they are not zero.

events.name: applicationCommandPermissionsUpdate
events.description:
Emitted whenever permissions for an application command in a guild were updated.
<warn>This includes permission updates for other applications in addition to the logged in client,
check `data.applicationId` to verify which application the update is for</warn>

params.name: data
params.description: The updated permissions

events.name: autoModerationActionExecution
events.description:
Emitted whenever an auto moderation rule is triggered.
<info>This event requires the {@link PermissionFlagsBits.ManageGuild} permission.</info>

params.name: autoModerationActionExecution
params.description: The data of the execution

events.name: autoModerationRuleCreate
events.description:
Emitted whenever an auto moderation rule is created.
<info>This event requires the {@link PermissionFlagsBits.ManageGuild} permission.</info>

params.name: autoModerationRule
params.description: The created auto moderation rule

events.name: autoModerationRuleDelete
events.description:
Emitted whenever an auto moderation rule is deleted.
<info>This event requires the {@link PermissionFlagsBits.ManageGuild} permission.</info>

params.name: autoModerationRule
params.description: The deleted auto moderation rule

events.name: autoModerationRuleUpdate
events.description:
Emitted whenever an auto moderation rule gets updated.
<info>This event requires the {@link PermissionFlagsBits.ManageGuild} permission.</info>

params.name: oldAutoModerationRule
params.description: The auto moderation rule before the update

params.name: newAutoModerationRule
params.description: The auto moderation rule after the update

events.name: channelCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild channel is created.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel that was created

events.name: channelDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a channel is deleted.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel that was deleted

events.name: entitlementCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever an entitlement is created.

params.name: entitlement

events.name: entitlementDelete
events.description:
Emitted whenever an entitlement is deleted.
<warn>Entitlements are not deleted when they expire.
This is only triggered when Discord issues a refund or deletes the entitlement manually.</warn>

events.name: entitlementUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever an entitlement is updated - i.e. when a user's subscription renews.

params.name: newEntitlement

Emitted whenever a user's details (e.g. username) are changed.
Triggered by the Discord gateway events {@link Events.UserUpdate},

params.name: oldUser

params.name: newUser
params.description: The user after the update

params.name: newState

params.description: The channel that had a webhook update

events.name: webhookUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a channel has its webhooks changed.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel that had a webhook update

events.name: debug
events.description: Emitted for general debugging information.

params.name: info
params.description: The debug information

events.name: warn

params.name: info

events.name: channelPinsUpdate
events.description:
Emitted whenever the pins of a channel are updated. Due to the nature of the WebSocket event,
not much information can be provided easily here - you need to manually check the pins yourself.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel that the pins update occurred in

params.name: time
params.description: The time of the pins update

events.name: channelUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a channel is updated - e.g. name change, topic change, channel type change.

params.name: oldChannel
params.description: The channel before the update

params.name: newChannel
params.description: The channel after the update

events.name: messageUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a message is updated - e.g. embed or content change.

params.name: newMessage
params.description: The message after the update

events.name: threadUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a thread is updated - e.g. name change, archive state change, locked state change.

params.name: newThread
params.description: The thread after the update

events.name: shardReady
events.description: Emitted when a shard turns ready.

params.description: The shard id that turned ready

params.name: unavailableGuilds

events.name: shardDisconnect
events.description: Emitted when a shard's WebSocket disconnects and will no longer reconnect.

params.description: The WebSocket close event

events.name: shardReconnecting
events.description: Emitted when a shard is attempting to reconnect or re-identify.

events.name: shardError
events.description: Emitted whenever a shard's WebSocket encounters a connection error.

events.name: ready
events.description: Emitted when the client becomes ready to start working.

params.name: client
params.description: The client

events.name: error
events.description:
Emitted when the client encounters an error.
<warn>Errors thrown within this event do not have a catch handler, it is
recommended to not use async functions as `error` event handlers. See the
[Node.js docs](https://nodejs.org/api/events.html#capture-rejections-of-promises) for details.</warn>

params.name: error
params.description: The error encountered

classes.name: WebSocketManager
classes.description:
The WebSocket manager for this client.
<info>This class forwards raw dispatch events,
read more about it here {@link https://discord.com/developers/docs/topics/gateway}</info>

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated this WebSocketManager

props.name: gateway
props.description: The gateway this manager uses

props.name: shards
props.description: A collection of all shards this manager handles

props.name: packetQueue
props.description: An array of queued events before this WebSocketManager became ready

props.name: status
props.description: The current status of this WebSocketManager

props.name: destroyed
props.description: If this manager was destroyed. It will prevent shards from reconnecting

props.name: _ws
props.description: The internal WebSocketManager from `@discordjs/ws`.

props.name: ping
props.description: The average ping of all WebSocketShards

methods.name: debug
methods.description: Emits a debug message.

params.name: messages
params.description: The debug message

params.name: shardId
params.description: The id of the shard that emitted this message, if any

methods.name: connect
methods.description: Connects this manager to the gateway.

methods.name: attachEvents
methods.description: Attaches event handlers to the internal WebSocketShardManager from `@discordjs/ws`.

methods.name: broadcast
methods.description: Broadcasts a packet to every shard this manager handles.

params.name: packet
params.description: The packet to send

methods.name: destroy
methods.description: Destroys this manager and all its shards.

methods.name: handlePacket
methods.description: Processes a packet and queues it if this WebSocketManager is not ready.

params.name: packet
params.description: The packet to be handled

params.name: shard
params.description: The shard that will handle this packet

methods.name: checkShardsReady
methods.description: Checks whether the client is ready to be marked as ready.

methods.name: triggerClientReady
methods.description: Causes the client to be marked as ready and emits the ready event.

classes.name: WebSocketShard

props.name: manager
props.description: The WebSocketManager of the shard

props.name: id

props.name: status
props.description: The current status of the shard

props.name: closeSequence
props.description: The sequence of the shard after close

props.name: ping
props.description: The previous heartbeat ping of the shard

props.name: lastPingTimestamp
props.description: The last time a ping was sent (a timestamp)

props.name: expectedGuilds
props.description: A set of guild ids this shard expects to receive

props.name: readyTimeout
props.description: The ready timeout

props.name: sessionInfo
props.description: The session info used by `@discordjs/ws` package.

methods.name: debug
methods.description: Emits a debug event.

params.name: messages
params.description: The debug message

methods.name: emitClose
methods.description:
This method is responsible to emit close event for this shard.
This method helps the shard reconnect.

params.name: event
params.description: Close event that was received

methods.name: onReadyPacket
methods.description: Called when the shard receives the READY payload.

params.name: packet
params.description: The received packet

methods.name: gotGuild
methods.description:
Called when a GuildCreate or GuildDelete for this shard was sent after READY payload was received,
but before we emitted the READY event.

params.name: guildId
params.description: the id of the Guild sent in the payload

methods.name: checkReady
methods.description: Checks if the shard can be marked as ready

methods.name: send
methods.description:
Adds a packet to the queue to be sent to the gateway.
<warn>If you use this method, make sure you understand that you need to provide
a full [Payload](https://discord.com/developers/docs/topics/gateway#commands-and-events-gateway-commands).
Do not use this method if you don't know what you're doing.</warn>

params.name: data
params.description: The full packet to send

params.name: important
params.description:
If this packet should be added first in queue
<warn>This parameter is **deprecated**. Important payloads are determined by their opcode instead.</warn>

events.name: resumed
events.description: Emitted when the shard resumes successfully

events.name: close
events.description: Emitted when a shard's WebSocket closes.

params.name: event
params.description: The received event

events.name: ready
events.description: Emitted when the shard receives the READY payload and is now waiting for guilds

events.name: allReady
events.description:
Emitted when the shard is fully ready.
This event is emitted if:
* all guilds were received by this shard
* the ready timeout expired, and some guilds are unavailable

params.name: unavailableGuilds
params.description: Set of unavailable guilds, if any

methods.description:
Kicks a user from the guild.
<info>The user must be a member of the guild</info>

params.name: user
params.description: The member to kick

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for kicking

returns.description:
Result object will be resolved as specifically as possible.
If the GuildMember cannot be resolved, the User will instead be attempted to be resolved. If that also cannot
be resolved, the user's id will be the result.

methods.name: ban
methods.description: Bans a user from the guild.

params.name: user
params.description: The user to ban

params.name: options
params.description: Options for the ban

returns.description:
Result object will be resolved as specifically as possible.
If the GuildMember cannot be resolved, the User will instead be attempted to be resolved. If that also cannot
be resolved, the user id will be the result.
Internally calls the GuildBanManager#create method.

methods.name: unban
methods.description: Unbans a user from the guild. Internally calls the {@link GuildBanManager#remove} method.

params.name: user
params.description: The user to unban

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for unbanning user

returns.description: The user that was unbanned

methods.name: bulkBan
methods.description: Bulk ban users from a guild, and optionally delete previous messages sent by them.

params.name: users
params.description: The users to ban

params.name: options
params.description: The options for bulk banning users

returns.description:
Returns an object with `bannedUsers` key containing the IDs of the banned users
and the key `failedUsers` with the IDs that could not be banned or were already banned.
Internally calls the GuildBanManager#bulkCreate method.

classes.name: Shard
classes.description:
A self-contained shard created by the {@link ShardingManager}. Each one has a {@link ChildProcess} that contains
an instance of the bot and its {@link Client}. When its child process/worker exits for any reason, the shard will
spawn a new one to replace it as necessary.

props.description: Manager that created the shard

props.name: id
props.description: The shard's id in the manager

props.name: silent
props.description: Whether to pass silent flag to the shard's process (only when {@link ShardingManager#mode} is `process`)

props.name: args
props.description: Arguments for the shard's process/worker

props.name: execArgv
props.description: Arguments for the shard's process/worker executable

props.name: env
props.description: Environment variables for the shard's process, or workerData for the shard's worker

props.name: ready
props.description: Whether the shard's {@link Client} is ready

props.name: process
props.description: Process of the shard (if {@link ShardingManager#mode} is `process`)

props.name: worker
props.description: Worker of the shard (if {@link ShardingManager#mode} is `worker`)

props.name: _evals
props.description: Ongoing promises for calls to {@link Shard#eval}, mapped by the `script` they were called with

props.name: _fetches
props.description: Ongoing promises for calls to {@link Shard#fetchClientValue}, mapped by the `prop` they were called with

props.name: _exitListener
props.description: Listener function for the {@link ChildProcess}' `exit` event

methods.name: spawn
methods.description:
Forks a child process or creates a worker thread for the shard.
<warn>You should not need to call this manually.</warn>

params.name: timeout
params.description:
The amount in milliseconds to wait until the {@link Client} has become ready
before resolving (`-1` or `Infinity` for no wait)

The amount in milliseconds to wait until the {@link Client}
has become ready (`-1` or `Infinity` for no wait)

classes.name: ShardingManager
classes.description:
This is a utility class that makes multi-process sharding of a bot an easy and painless experience.
It works by spawning a self-contained {@link ChildProcess} or {@link Worker} for each individual shard, each
containing its own instance of your bot's {@link Client}. They all have a line of communication with the master
process, and there are several useful methods that utilise it in order to simplify tasks that are normally difficult
with sharding. It can spawn a specific number of shards or the amount that Discord suggests for the bot, and takes a
path to your main bot script to launch for each one.

params.name: file
params.description: Path to your shard script file

params.name: options
params.description: Options for the sharding manager

props.name: file
props.description: Path to the shard script file

props.name: shardList
props.description: List of shards this sharding manager spawns

props.name: totalShards
props.description: Amount of shards that all sharding managers spawn in total

props.name: mode
props.description: Mode for shards to spawn with

props.name: respawn
props.description: Whether shards should automatically respawn upon exiting

props.name: silent
props.description: Whether to pass the silent flag to child process (only when {@link ShardingManager#mode} is `process`)

props.name: shardArgs
props.description: An array of arguments to pass to shards (only when {@link ShardingManager#mode} is `process`)

props.name: execArgv
props.description: An array of arguments to pass to the executable (only when {@link ShardingManager#mode} is `process`)

props.name: token
props.description: Token to use for obtaining the automatic shard count, and passing to shards

props.name: shards
props.description: A collection of shards that this manager has spawned

methods.name: createShard
methods.description:
Creates a single shard.
<warn>Using this method is usually not necessary if you use the spawn method.</warn>

params.name: id
params.description:
Id of the shard to create
<info>This is usually not necessary to manually specify.</info>

returns.description: Note that the created shard needs to be explicitly spawned using its spawn method.

methods.name: spawn
methods.description: Spawns multiple shards.

params.name: options
params.description: Options for spawning shards

methods.name: broadcast
methods.description: Sends a message to all shards.

params.name: message
params.description: Message to be sent to the shards

methods.name: broadcastEval
methods.description: Evaluates a script on all shards, or a given shard, in the context of the {@link Client}s.

params.name: script
params.description: JavaScript to run on each shard

params.name: options
params.description: The options for the broadcast

returns.description: Results of the script execution

methods.name: fetchClientValues
methods.description: Fetches a client property value of each shard, or a given shard.

params.name: shard
params.description: Shard to fetch property from, all if undefined

classes.name: ApplicationCommand
classes.description: Represents an application command.

props.name: id
props.description: The command's id

props.name: applicationId
props.description: The parent application's id

props.name: guild
props.description: The guild this command is part of

props.name: guildId
props.description:
The guild's id this command is part of, this may be non-null when `guild` is `null` if the command
was fetched from the `ApplicationCommandManager`

props.name: permissions
props.description: The manager for permissions of this command on its guild or arbitrary guilds when the command is global

props.name: type
props.description: The type of this application command

props.name: nsfw
props.description: Whether this command is age-restricted (18+)

props.name: name
props.description: The name of this command

props.name: nameLocalizations
props.description: The name localizations for this command

props.name: nameLocalized
props.description: The localized name for this command

props.name: description
props.description: The description of this command

props.name: descriptionLocalizations
props.description: The description localizations for this command

props.name: descriptionLocalized
props.description: The localized description for this command

props.name: options
props.description: The options of this command

props.name: defaultMemberPermissions
props.description: The default bitfield used to determine whether this command be used in a guild

props.name: dmPermission
props.description:
Whether the command can be used in DMs
<info>This property is always `null` on guild commands</info>

props.name: integrationTypes
props.description:
Installation context(s) where the command is available
<info>Only for globally-scoped commands</info>

props.name: contexts
props.description:
Interaction context(s) where the command can be used
<info>Only for globally-scoped commands</info>

props.name: version
props.description: Autoincrementing version identifier updated during substantial record changes

props.name: createdTimestamp
props.description: The timestamp the command was created at

props.name: createdAt
props.description: The time the command was created at

props.name: manager
props.description: The manager that this command belongs to

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated this

methods.name: edit
methods.description: Edits this application command.

params.name: data
params.description: The data to update the command with

methods.name: setName
methods.description: Edits the name of this ApplicationCommand

params.name: name
params.description: The new name of the command

methods.name: setNameLocalizations
methods.description: Edits the localized names of this ApplicationCommand

params.name: nameLocalizations
params.description: The new localized names for the command

methods.name: setDescription
methods.description: Edits the description of this ApplicationCommand

params.name: description
params.description: The new description of the command

methods.name: setDescriptionLocalizations
methods.description: Edits the localized descriptions of this ApplicationCommand

params.name: descriptionLocalizations
params.description: The new localized descriptions for the command

methods.name: setDefaultMemberPermissions
methods.description: Edits the default member permissions of this ApplicationCommand

params.name: defaultMemberPermissions
params.description: The default member permissions required to run this command

methods.name: setDMPermission
methods.description: Edits the DM permission of this ApplicationCommand

params.name: dmPermission
params.description: Whether the command can be used in DMs

methods.name: setOptions
methods.description: Edits the options of this ApplicationCommand

params.name: options
params.description: The options to set for this command

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes this command.

methods.name: equals
methods.description:
Whether this command equals another command. It compares all properties, so for most operations
it is advisable to just compare `command.id === command2.id` as it is much faster and is often
what most users need.

params.name: command
params.description: The command to compare with

params.name: enforceOptionOrder
params.description:
Whether to strictly check that options and choices are in the same
order in the array <info>The client may not always respect this ordering!</info>

methods.name: optionsEqual
methods.description:
Recursively checks that all options for an {@link ApplicationCommand} are equal to the provided options.
In most cases it is better to compare using {@link ApplicationCommand#equals}

params.name: existing
params.description:
The options on the existing command,
should be {@link ApplicationCommand#options}

params.name: options
params.description: The options to compare against

params.name: enforceOptionOrder
params.description:
Whether to strictly check that options and choices are in the same
order in the array <info>The client may not always respect this ordering!</info>

methods.name: _optionEquals
methods.description:
Checks that an option for an {@link ApplicationCommand} is equal to the provided option
In most cases it is better to compare using {@link ApplicationCommand#equals}

params.name: existing
params.description:
The option on the existing command,
should be from {@link ApplicationCommand#options}

params.name: option
params.description: The option to compare against

params.name: enforceOptionOrder
params.description:
Whether to strictly check that options or choices are in the same
order in their array <info>The client may not always respect this ordering!</info>

methods.name: transformOption
methods.description: Transforms an {@link ApplicationCommandOptionData} object into something that can be used with the API.

params.name: option
params.description: The option to transform

params.name: received
params.description: Whether this option has been received from Discord

classes.name: ApplicationEmoji
classes.description: Represents a custom emoji.

props.name: application
props.description: The application this emoji originates from

props.name: author
props.description: The user who created this emoji

props.name: managed
props.description: Whether this emoji is managed by an external service

props.name: requiresColons
props.description: Whether or not this emoji requires colons surrounding it

props.name: animated
props.description: Whether or not the emoji is animated

props.name: name
props.description: The emoji's name

props.name: id
props.description: The emoji's id

props.name: identifier
props.description: The identifier of this emoji, used for message reactions

props.name: url
props.description: Returns a URL for the emoji or `null` if this is not a custom emoji.

props.name: createdTimestamp
props.description: The timestamp the emoji was created at, or null if unicode

props.name: createdAt
props.description: The time the emoji was created at, or null if unicode

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated this

methods.name: fetchAuthor
methods.description: Fetches the author for this emoji

methods.name: edit
methods.description: Edits the emoji.

params.name: options
params.description: The options to provide

methods.name: setName
methods.description: Sets the name of the emoji.

params.name: name
params.description: The new name for the emoji

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the emoji.

methods.name: equals
methods.description: Whether this emoji is the same as another one.

params.name: other
params.description: The emoji to compare it to

methods.name: imageURL
methods.description: Returns a URL for the emoji or `null` if this is not a custom emoji.

params.name: options
params.description: Options for the image URL

methods.name: toString
methods.description:
When concatenated with a string, this automatically returns the text required to form a graphical emoji on Discord
instead of the Emoji object.
examples:
// Send the emoji used in a reaction to the channel the reaction is part of
reaction.message.channel.send(`The emoji used was: ${reaction.emoji}`);

classes.name: AutoModerationActionExecution
classes.description: Represents the structure of an executed action when an {@link AutoModerationRule} is triggered.

props.name: guild
props.description: The guild where this action was executed from.

props.name: action
props.description: The action that was executed.

props.name: ruleId
props.description: The id of the auto moderation rule this action belongs to.

props.name: ruleTriggerType
props.description: The trigger type of the auto moderation rule which was triggered.

props.name: userId
props.description: The id of the user that triggered this action.

props.name: channelId
props.description: The id of the channel where this action was triggered from.

props.name: messageId
props.description:
The id of the message that triggered this action.
<info>This will not be present if the message was blocked or the content was not part of any message.</info>

props.name: alertSystemMessageId
props.description: The id of any system auto moderation messages posted as a result of this action.

props.name: content
props.description:
The content that triggered this action.
<info>This property requires the {@link GatewayIntentBits.MessageContent} privileged gateway intent.</info>

props.name: matchedKeyword
props.description: The word or phrase configured in the rule that triggered this action.

props.name: matchedContent
props.description: The substring in content that triggered this action.

props.name: autoModerationRule
props.description: The auto moderation rule this action belongs to.

props.name: channel
props.description: The channel where this action was triggered from.

props.name: user
props.description: The user that triggered this action.

props.name: member
props.description: The guild member that triggered this action.

props.description: The client that instantiated this

classes.name: BaseChannel
classes.description: Represents any channel on Discord.

props.name: type
props.description: The type of the channel

props.name: flags
props.description:
The flags that are applied to the channel.
<info>This is only `null` in a {@link PartialGroupDMChannel}. In all other cases, it is not `null`.</info>

props.name: id
props.description: The channel's id

props.name: createdTimestamp
props.description: The timestamp the channel was created at

props.name: createdAt
props.description: The time the channel was created at

props.name: url
props.description: The URL to the channel

props.name: partial
props.description:
Whether this Channel is a partial
<info>This is always false outside of DM channels.</info>

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated this

methods.name: toString
methods.description: When concatenated with a string, this automatically returns the channel's mention instead of the Channel object.
examples:
// Logs: Hello from <#123456789012345678>!
console.log(`Hello from ${channel}!`);

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes this channel.

methods.description: Fetches this channel.

params.description: Whether to skip the cache check and request the API

methods.description: Indicates whether this channel is a {@link ThreadChannel}.

methods.name: isTextBased
methods.description: Indicates whether this channel is {@link TextBasedChannels text-based}.

methods.name: isDMBased
methods.description: Indicates whether this channel is DM-based (either a {@link DMChannel} or a {@link PartialGroupDMChannel}).

methods.name: isVoiceBased
methods.description: Indicates whether this channel is {@link BaseGuildVoiceChannel voice-based}.

methods.name: isThreadOnly
methods.description: Indicates whether this channel is {@link ThreadOnlyChannel thread-only}.

methods.description: Sets the full presence of the client user.

// Set the client user's presence
client.user.setPresence({ activities: [{ name: 'with discord.js' }], status: 'idle' });

params.name: data

params.name: status

params.name: shardId
params.description: Shard id(s) to have the activity set on

methods.description:
Checks if the user is equal to another.
It compares id, username, discriminator, avatar, banner, accent color, and bot flags.
It is recommended to compare equality by using `user.id === user2.id` unless you want to compare all properties.

methods.name: get

params.name: required
params.description: Whether to throw an error if the option is not found.

params.description: Whether to throw an error if the option is not found.

returns.description: The option, if found.

params.description: Whether to throw an error if there is no subcommand.

returns.description: The value of the option, or null if not set and not required.

classes.name: InteractionCollector
classes.description:
Collects interactions.
Will automatically stop if the message ({@link Client#event:messageDelete messageDelete} or
{@link Client#event:messageDeleteBulk messageDeleteBulk}),
channel ({@link Client#event:channelDelete channelDelete}), or
guild ({@link Client#event:guildDelete guildDelete}) is deleted.
<info>Interaction collectors that do not specify `time` or `idle` may be prone to always running.
Ensure your interaction collectors end via either of these options or manual cancellation.</info>

params.name: client
params.description: The client on which to collect interactions

params.name: options
params.description: The options to apply to this collector

props.name: messageId
props.description: The message from which to collect interactions, if provided

props.name: messageInteractionId
props.description: The message interaction id from which to collect interactions, if provided

props.name: channelId
props.description: The channel from which to collect interactions, if provided

props.name: guildId
props.description: The guild from which to collect interactions, if provided

props.name: interactionType
props.description: The type of interaction to collect

props.name: componentType
props.description: The type of component to collect

props.name: users
props.description: The users that have interacted with this collector

props.name: total
props.description: The total number of interactions collected

props.name: endReason
props.description: The reason this collector has ended with, or null if it hasn't ended yet

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated this Collector

props.name: filter
props.description: The filter applied to this collector

props.name: options
props.description: The options of this collector

props.name: collected
props.description: The items collected by this collector

props.name: ended
props.description: Whether this collector has finished collecting

props.name: _timeout
props.description: Timeout for cleanup

props.name: _idletimeout
props.description: Timeout for cleanup due to inactivity

props.name: _endReason
props.description: The reason the collector ended

props.name: lastCollectedTimestamp
props.description: The timestamp at which this collector last collected an item

props.name: lastCollectedAt
props.description: The Date at which this collector last collected an item

props.name: next
props.description:
Returns a promise that resolves with the next collected element;
rejects with collected elements if the collector finishes without receiving a next element

methods.name: collect
methods.description: Handles an incoming interaction for possible collection.

params.name: interaction
params.description: The interaction to possibly collect

methods.name: dispose
methods.description: Handles an interaction for possible disposal.

params.name: interaction
params.description: The interaction that could be disposed of

methods.name: empty
methods.description: Empties this interaction collector.

methods.name: _handleMessageDeletion
methods.description: Handles checking if the message has been deleted, and if so, stops the collector with the reason 'messageDelete'.

params.name: message
params.description: The message that was deleted

methods.name: _handleChannelDeletion
methods.description: Handles checking if the channel has been deleted, and if so, stops the collector with the reason 'channelDelete'.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel that was deleted

methods.name: _handleThreadDeletion
methods.description: Handles checking if the thread has been deleted, and if so, stops the collector with the reason 'threadDelete'.

params.name: thread
params.description: The thread that was deleted

methods.name: _handleGuildDeletion
methods.description: Handles checking if the guild has been deleted, and if so, stops the collector with the reason 'guildDelete'.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that was deleted

methods.name: handleCollect
methods.description: Call this to handle an event as a collectable element. Accepts any event data as parameters.

params.name: args
params.description: The arguments emitted by the listener

methods.name: handleDispose
methods.description: Call this to remove an element from the collection. Accepts any event data as parameters.

params.name: args
params.description: The arguments emitted by the listener

methods.name: stop
methods.description: Stops this collector and emits the `end` event.

params.name: reason
params.description: The reason this collector is ending

methods.name: resetTimer
methods.description: Resets the collector's timeout and idle timer.

params.name: options
params.description: Options for resetting

methods.name: checkEnd
methods.description: Checks whether the collector should end, and if so, ends it.

returns.description: Whether the collector ended or not

events.name: collect
events.description: Emitted whenever an interaction is collected.

params.name: interaction
params.description: The interaction that was collected

events.name: dispose
events.description: Emitted whenever an interaction is disposed of.

params.name: interaction
params.description: The interaction that was disposed of

events.name: ignore
events.description: Emitted whenever an element is not collected by the collector.

params.name: args
params.description: The arguments emitted by the listener

events.name: end
events.description: Emitted when the collector is finished collecting.

params.name: collected
params.description: The elements collected by the collector

params.name: reason
params.description: The reason the collector ended

classes.name: Message
classes.description: Represents a message on Discord.

props.name: channelId
props.description: The id of the channel the message was sent in

props.name: guildId
props.description: The id of the guild the message was sent in, if any

props.name: id
props.description: The message's id

props.name: createdTimestamp
props.description: The timestamp the message was sent at

props.name: type
props.description: The type of the message

props.name: system
props.description: Whether or not this message was sent by Discord, not actually a user (e.g. pin notifications)

props.name: content
props.description:
The content of the message.
<info>This property requires the {@link GatewayIntentBits.MessageContent} privileged intent
in a guild for messages that do not mention the client.</info>

props.name: author
props.description: The author of the message

props.name: pinned
props.description: Whether or not this message is pinned

props.name: tts
props.description: Whether or not the message was Text-To-Speech

props.name: nonce
props.description:
A random number or string used for checking message delivery
<warn>This is only received after the message was sent successfully, and
lost if re-fetched</warn>

props.name: embeds
props.description:
An array of embeds in the message - e.g. YouTube Player.
<info>This property requires the {@link GatewayIntentBits.MessageContent} privileged intent
in a guild for messages that do not mention the client.</info>

props.name: components
props.description:
An array of action rows in the message.
<info>This property requires the {@link GatewayIntentBits.MessageContent} privileged intent
in a guild for messages that do not mention the client.</info>

props.name: attachments
props.description:
A collection of attachments in the message - e.g. Pictures - mapped by their ids.
<info>This property requires the {@link GatewayIntentBits.MessageContent} privileged intent
in a guild for messages that do not mention the client.</info>

props.name: stickers
props.description: A collection of stickers in the message

props.name: position
props.description:
A generally increasing integer (there may be gaps or duplicates) that represents
the approximate position of the message in a thread.

props.name: roleSubscriptionData
props.description:
The data of the role subscription purchase or renewal.
<info>This is present on {@link MessageType.RoleSubscriptionPurchase} messages.</info>

props.name: editedTimestamp
props.description: The timestamp the message was last edited at (if applicable)

props.name: reactions
props.description: A manager of the reactions belonging to this message

props.name: mentions
props.description: All valid mentions that the message contains

props.name: webhookId
props.description: The id of the webhook that sent the message, if applicable

props.name: groupActivityApplication
props.description: Supplemental application information for group activities

props.name: applicationId
props.description: The id of the application of the interaction that sent this message, if any

props.name: activity
props.description: Group activity

props.name: flags
props.description: Flags that are applied to the message

props.name: reference
props.description: Message reference data

props.name: interactionMetadata
props.description: Partial data of the interaction that this message is a result of

props.name: interaction
props.description: Partial data of the interaction that this message is a reply to

props.name: poll
props.description: The poll that was sent with the message

props.name: call
props.description: The call associated with the message

props.name: channel
props.description: The channel that the message was sent in

props.name: partial
props.description: Whether or not this message is a partial

props.name: member
props.description:
Represents the author of the message as a guild member.
Only available if the message comes from a guild where the author is still a member

props.name: createdAt
props.description: The time the message was sent at

props.name: editedAt
props.description: The time the message was last edited at (if applicable)

props.name: guild
props.description: The guild the message was sent in (if in a guild channel)

props.name: hasThread
props.description: Whether this message has a thread associated with it

props.name: thread
props.description:
The thread started by this message
<info>This property is not suitable for checking whether a message has a thread,
use {@link Message#hasThread} instead.</info>

props.name: url
props.description: The URL to jump to this message

props.name: cleanContent
props.description:
The message contents with all mentions replaced by the equivalent text.
If mentions cannot be resolved to a name, the relevant mention in the message content will not be converted.

props.name: editable
props.description: Whether the message is editable by the client user

props.name: deletable
props.description: Whether the message is deletable by the client user

props.name: bulkDeletable
props.description: Whether the message is bulk deletable by the client user

props.name: pinnable
props.description: Whether the message is pinnable by the client user

props.name: crosspostable
props.description: Whether the message is crosspostable by the client user

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated this

  .catch(console.error)

params.description: The emoji to react with

methods.description: Deletes the message.

methods.description: Send an inline reply to this message.

params.description: The options to provide

methods.description: Create a new public thread from this message

params.name: options
params.description: Options for starting a thread on this message

methods.name: fetch
methods.description: Fetch this message.

params.name: force
params.description: Whether to skip the cache check and request the API

methods.name: fetchWebhook
methods.description: Fetches the webhook used to create this message.

methods.name: suppressEmbeds
methods.description: Suppresses or unsuppresses embeds on a message.

params.name: suppress
params.description: If the embeds should be suppressed or not

methods.name: removeAttachments
methods.description: Removes the attachments from this message.

methods.name: resolveComponent
methods.description: Resolves a component by a custom id.

params.name: customId
params.description: The custom id to resolve against

methods.name: equals
methods.description:
Used mainly internally. Whether two messages are identical in properties. If you want to compare messages
without checking all the properties, use `message.id === message2.id`, which is much more efficient. This
method allows you to see if there are differences in content, embeds, attachments, nonce and tts properties.

params.name: message
params.description: The message to compare it to

params.name: rawData
params.description: Raw data passed through the WebSocket about this message

methods.name: inGuild
methods.description: Whether this message is from a guild.

methods.name: toString
methods.description: When concatenated with a string, this automatically concatenates the message's content instead of the object.
examples:
// Logs: Message: This is a message!
console.log(`Message: ${message}`);

classes.name: MessageCollector
classes.description:
Collects messages on a channel.
Will automatically stop if the channel ({@link Client#event:channelDelete channelDelete}),
thread ({@link Client#event:threadDelete threadDelete}), or
guild ({@link Client#event:guildDelete guildDelete}) is deleted.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel

params.name: options
params.description: The options to be applied to this collector

props.name: channel
props.description: The channel

props.name: received
props.description: Total number of messages that were received in the channel during message collection

props.name: endReason
props.description: The reason this collector has ended with, or null if it hasn't ended yet

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated this Collector

props.name: filter
props.description: The filter applied to this collector

props.name: options
props.description: The options of this collector

props.name: collected
props.description: The items collected by this collector

props.name: ended
props.description: Whether this collector has finished collecting

props.name: _timeout
props.description: Timeout for cleanup

props.name: _idletimeout
props.description: Timeout for cleanup due to inactivity

props.name: _endReason
props.description: The reason the collector ended

props.name: lastCollectedTimestamp
props.description: The timestamp at which this collector last collected an item

props.name: lastCollectedAt
props.description: The Date at which this collector last collected an item

props.name: next
props.description:
Returns a promise that resolves with the next collected element;
rejects with collected elements if the collector finishes without receiving a next element

methods.name: collect
methods.description: Handles a message for possible collection.

params.name: message
params.description: The message that could be collected

methods.name: dispose
methods.description: Handles a message for possible disposal.

params.name: message
params.description: The message that could be disposed of

methods.name: _handleChannelDeletion
methods.description: Handles checking if the channel has been deleted, and if so, stops the collector with the reason 'channelDelete'.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel that was deleted

methods.name: _handleThreadDeletion
methods.description: Handles checking if the thread has been deleted, and if so, stops the collector with the reason 'threadDelete'.

params.name: thread
params.description: The thread that was deleted

methods.name: _handleGuildDeletion
methods.description: Handles checking if the guild has been deleted, and if so, stops the collector with the reason 'guildDelete'.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that was deleted

methods.name: handleCollect
methods.description: Call this to handle an event as a collectable element. Accepts any event data as parameters.

params.name: args
params.description: The arguments emitted by the listener

methods.name: handleDispose
methods.description: Call this to remove an element from the collection. Accepts any event data as parameters.

params.name: args
params.description: The arguments emitted by the listener

methods.name: stop
methods.description: Stops this collector and emits the `end` event.

params.name: reason
params.description: The reason this collector is ending

methods.name: resetTimer
methods.description: Resets the collector's timeout and idle timer.

params.name: options
params.description: Options for resetting

methods.name: checkEnd
methods.description: Checks whether the collector should end, and if so, ends it.

returns.description: Whether the collector ended or not

events.name: collect
events.description: Emitted whenever a message is collected.

params.name: message
params.description: The message that was collected

events.name: dispose
events.description: Emitted whenever a message is disposed of.

params.name: message
params.description: The message that was disposed of

events.name: ignore
events.description: Emitted whenever an element is not collected by the collector.

params.name: args
params.description: The arguments emitted by the listener

events.name: end
events.description: Emitted when the collector is finished collecting.

params.name: collected
params.description: The elements collected by the collector

params.name: reason
params.description: The reason the collector ended

classes.name: MessageMentions
classes.description: Keeps track of mentions in a {@link Message}.

props.name: everyone
props.description: Whether `@everyone` or `@here` were mentioned

props.name: users
props.description:
Any users that were mentioned
<info>Order as received from the API, not as they appear in the message content</info>

props.name: roles
props.description:
Any roles that were mentioned
<info>Order as received from the API, not as they appear in the message content</info>

props.name: _members
props.description: Cached members for {@link MessageMentions#members}

props.name: _channels
props.description: Cached channels for {@link MessageMentions#channels}

props.name: _parsedUsers
props.description: Cached users for {@link MessageMentions#parsedUsers}

props.name: crosspostedChannels
props.description:
A collection of crossposted channels
<info>Order as received from the API, not as they appear in the message content</info>

props.name: repliedUser
props.description: The author of the message that this message is a reply to

props.name: members
props.description:
Any members that were mentioned (only in {@link Guild}s)
<info>Order as received from the API, not as they appear in the message content</info>

props.name: channels
props.description:
Any channels that were mentioned
<info>Order as they appear first in the message content</info>

props.name: parsedUsers
props.description:
Any user mentions that were included in the message content
<info>Order as they appear first in the message content</info>

props.name: EveryonePattern
props.description:
A regular expression that matches `@everyone` and `@here`.
The `mention` group property is present on the `exec` result of this expression.

props.name: UsersPattern
props.description:
A regular expression that matches user mentions like `<@81440962496172032>`.
The `id` group property is present on the `exec` result of this expression.

props.name: RolesPattern
props.description:
A regular expression that matches role mentions like `<@&297577916114403338>`.
The `id` group property is present on the `exec` result of this expression.

props.name: ChannelsPattern
props.description:
A regular expression that matches channel mentions like `<#222079895583457280>`.
The `id` group property is present on the `exec` result of this expression.

props.name: GlobalChannelsPattern
props.description: A global regular expression variant of {@link MessageMentions.ChannelsPattern}.

props.name: GlobalUsersPattern
props.description: A global regular expression variant of {@link MessageMentions.UsersPattern}.

methods.name: has
methods.description:
Checks if a user, guild member, thread member, role, or channel is mentioned.
Takes into account user mentions, role mentions, channel mentions,
replied user mention, and `@everyone`/`@here` mentions.

params.name: data
params.description: The User/Role/Channel to check for

params.name: options
params.description: The options for the check

classes.name: ReactionCollector
classes.description:
Collects reactions on messages.
Will automatically stop if the message ({@link Client#event:messageDelete messageDelete} or
{@link Client#event:messageDeleteBulk messageDeleteBulk}),
channel ({@link Client#event:channelDelete channelDelete}),
thread ({@link Client#event:threadDelete threadDelete}), or
guild ({@link Client#event:guildDelete guildDelete}) is deleted.

params.name: message
params.description: The message upon which to collect reactions

params.name: options
params.description: The options to apply to this collector

props.name: message
props.description: The message upon which to collect reactions

props.name: users
props.description: The users that have reacted to this message

props.name: total
props.description: The total number of reactions collected

props.name: endReason
props.description: The reason this collector has ended with, or null if it hasn't ended yet

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated this Collector

props.name: filter
props.description: The filter applied to this collector

props.name: options
props.description: The options of this collector

props.name: collected
props.description: The items collected by this collector

props.name: ended
props.description: Whether this collector has finished collecting

props.name: _timeout
props.description: Timeout for cleanup

props.name: _idletimeout
props.description: Timeout for cleanup due to inactivity

props.name: _endReason
props.description: The reason the collector ended

props.name: lastCollectedTimestamp
props.description: The timestamp at which this collector last collected an item

props.name: lastCollectedAt
props.description: The Date at which this collector last collected an item

props.name: next
props.description:
Returns a promise that resolves with the next collected element;
rejects with collected elements if the collector finishes without receiving a next element

methods.name: collect
methods.description: Handles an incoming reaction for possible collection.

params.name: reaction
params.description: The reaction to possibly collect

params.name: user
params.description: The user that added the reaction

methods.name: dispose
methods.description: Handles a reaction deletion for possible disposal.

params.name: reaction
params.description: The reaction to possibly dispose of

params.name: user
params.description: The user that removed the reaction

methods.name: empty
methods.description: Empties this reaction collector.

methods.name: _handleMessageDeletion
methods.description: Handles checking if the message has been deleted, and if so, stops the collector with the reason 'messageDelete'.

params.name: message
params.description: The message that was deleted

methods.name: _handleChannelDeletion
methods.description: Handles checking if the channel has been deleted, and if so, stops the collector with the reason 'channelDelete'.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel that was deleted

methods.name: _handleThreadDeletion
methods.description: Handles checking if the thread has been deleted, and if so, stops the collector with the reason 'threadDelete'.

params.name: thread
params.description: The thread that was deleted

methods.name: _handleGuildDeletion
methods.description: Handles checking if the guild has been deleted, and if so, stops the collector with the reason 'guildDelete'.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that was deleted

methods.name: handleCollect
methods.description: Call this to handle an event as a collectable element. Accepts any event data as parameters.

params.name: args
params.description: The arguments emitted by the listener

methods.name: handleDispose
methods.description: Call this to remove an element from the collection. Accepts any event data as parameters.

params.name: args
params.description: The arguments emitted by the listener

methods.name: stop
methods.description: Stops this collector and emits the `end` event.

params.name: reason
params.description: The reason this collector is ending

methods.name: resetTimer
methods.description: Resets the collector's timeout and idle timer.

params.name: options
params.description: Options for resetting

methods.name: checkEnd
methods.description: Checks whether the collector should end, and if so, ends it.

returns.description: Whether the collector ended or not

methods.name: key
methods.description: Gets the collector key for a reaction.

params.name: reaction
params.description: The message reaction to get the key for

events.name: create
events.description:
Emitted whenever a reaction is newly created on a message. Will emit only when a new reaction is
added to the message, as opposed to {@link Collector#event:collect} which will
be emitted even when a reaction has already been added to the message.

params.name: reaction
params.description: The reaction that was added

params.name: user
params.description: The user that added the reaction

events.name: collect
events.description: Emitted whenever a reaction is collected.

params.name: reaction
params.description: The reaction that was collected

params.name: user
params.description: The user that added the reaction

events.name: dispose
events.description: Emitted when the reaction had all the users removed and the `dispose` option is set to true.

params.name: reaction
params.description: The reaction that was disposed of

params.name: user
params.description: The user that removed the reaction

events.name: remove
events.description: Emitted when the reaction had one user removed and the `dispose` option is set to true.

params.name: reaction
params.description: The reaction that was removed

params.name: user
params.description: The user that removed the reaction

events.name: ignore
events.description: Emitted whenever an element is not collected by the collector.

params.name: args
params.description: The arguments emitted by the listener

events.name: end
events.description: Emitted when the collector is finished collecting.

params.name: collected
params.description: The elements collected by the collector

params.name: reason
params.description: The reason the collector ended

Represents a limited emoji set used for both custom and unicode emojis. Custom emojis

methods.description: Returns a URL for the emoji or `null` if this is not a custom emoji.

params.description: Options for the image URL

methods.description:
When concatenated with a string, this automatically returns the text required to form a graphical emoji on Discord
instead of the Emoji object.
examples:

reaction.message.channel.send(`The emoji used was: ${reaction.emoji}`);

classes.name: VoiceChannel
classes.description: Represents a guild voice channel on Discord.

props.name: joinable
props.description: Whether the channel is joinable by the client user

props.name: speakable
props.description: Checks if the client has permission to send audio to the voice channel

props.name: messages
props.description: A manager of the messages sent to this channel

props.name: nsfw
props.description: If the guild considers this channel NSFW

props.name: rtcRegion
props.description: The RTC region for this voice-based channel. This region is automatically selected if `null`.

props.name: bitrate
props.description: The bitrate of this voice-based channel

props.name: userLimit
props.description: The maximum amount of users allowed in this channel.

props.name: videoQualityMode
props.description: The camera video quality mode of the channel.

props.name: lastMessageId
props.description: The last message id sent in the channel, if one was sent

props.name: rateLimitPerUser
props.description: The rate limit per user (slowmode) for this channel in seconds

props.name: members
props.description: The members in this voice-based channel

props.name: full
props.description: Checks if the voice-based channel is full

props.name: lastMessage
props.description: The Message object of the last message in the channel, if one was sent

props.name: guild
props.description: The guild the channel is in

props.name: guildId
props.description: The id of the guild the channel is in

props.name: permissionOverwrites
props.description: A manager of permission overwrites that belong to this channel

props.name: name
props.description: The name of the guild channel

props.name: rawPosition
props.description: The raw position of the channel from Discord

props.name: parentId
props.description: The id of the category parent of this channel

props.name: parent
props.description: The category parent of this channel

props.name: permissionsLocked
props.description: If the permissionOverwrites match the parent channel, null if no parent

props.name: position
props.description: The position of the channel

props.name: deletable
props.description: Whether the channel is deletable by the client user

props.name: manageable
props.description: Whether the channel is manageable by the client user

props.name: viewable
props.description: Whether the channel is viewable by the client user

props.name: type
props.description: The type of the channel

props.name: flags
props.description:
The flags that are applied to the channel.
<info>This is only `null` in a {@link PartialGroupDMChannel}. In all other cases, it is not `null`.</info>

props.name: id
props.description: The channel's id

props.name: createdTimestamp
props.description: The timestamp the channel was created at

props.name: createdAt
props.description: The time the channel was created at

props.name: url
props.description: The URL to the channel

props.name: partial
props.description:
Whether this Channel is a partial
<info>This is always false outside of DM channels.</info>

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated this

methods.name: setBitrate
methods.description: Sets the bitrate of the channel.

params.name: bitrate
params.description: The new bitrate

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for changing the channel's bitrate

methods.name: setRTCRegion
methods.description: Sets the RTC region of the channel.
examples:
// Set the RTC region to sydney
voiceChannel.setRTCRegion('sydney');

// Remove a fixed region for this channel - let Discord decide automatically
voiceChannel.setRTCRegion(null, 'We want to let Discord decide.');

params.name: rtcRegion
params.description: The new region of the channel. Set to `null` to remove a specific region for the channel

params.name: reason
params.description: The reason for modifying this region.

methods.name: setUserLimit
methods.description: Sets the user limit of the channel.

params.name: userLimit
params.description: The new user limit

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for changing the user limit

methods.name: setVideoQualityMode
methods.description: Sets the camera video quality mode of the channel.

params.name: videoQualityMode
params.description: The new camera video quality mode.

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for changing the camera video quality mode.

methods.name: createInvite
methods.description: Creates an invite to this guild channel.

params.name: options
params.description: The options for creating the invite

methods.name: fetchInvites
methods.description: Fetches a collection of invites to this guild channel.

params.name: cache
params.description: Whether to cache the fetched invites

methods.name: send
methods.description: Sends a message to this channel.

params.name: options
params.description: The options to provide

methods.name: sendTyping
methods.description: Sends a typing indicator in the channel.
examples:
// Start typing in a channel
channel.sendTyping();

returns.description: Resolves upon the typing status being sent

methods.name: createMessageCollector
methods.description: Creates a Message Collector.

params.name: options
params.description: The options to pass to the collector

methods.name: awaitMessages
methods.description:
Similar to createMessageCollector but in promise form.
Resolves with a collection of messages that pass the specified filter.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional options to pass to the internal collector

methods.name: createMessageComponentCollector
methods.description: Creates a component interaction collector.

params.name: options
params.description: Options to send to the collector

methods.name: awaitMessageComponent
methods.description:
Collects a single component interaction that passes the filter.
The Promise will reject if the time expires.

params.name: options
params.description: Options to pass to the internal collector

methods.name: bulkDelete
methods.description: Bulk deletes given messages that are newer than two weeks.

params.name: messages
params.description: Messages or number of messages to delete

params.name: filterOld
params.description: Filter messages to remove those which are older than two weeks automatically

returns.description: Returns the deleted messages

methods.name: fetchWebhooks
methods.description: Fetches all webhooks for the channel.

methods.name: createWebhook
methods.description: Creates a webhook for the channel.

params.name: options
params.description: Options for creating the webhook

returns.description: Returns the created Webhook

methods.name: setRateLimitPerUser
methods.description: Sets the rate limit per user (slowmode) for this channel.

params.name: rateLimitPerUser
params.description: The new rate limit in seconds

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for changing the channel's rate limit

methods.description: Sets whether this channel is flagged as NSFW.

params.name: nsfw
params.description: Whether the channel should be considered NSFW

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for changing the channel's NSFW flag

methods.name: permissionsFor
methods.description: Gets the overall set of permissions for a member or role in this channel, taking into account channel overwrites.

params.name: memberOrRole
params.description: The member or role to obtain the overall permissions for

params.name: checkAdmin
params.description:
Whether having the {@link PermissionFlagsBits.Administrator} permission
will return all permissions

methods.name: memberPermissions
methods.description: Gets the overall set of permissions for a member in this channel, taking into account channel overwrites.

params.name: member
params.description: The member to obtain the overall permissions for

params.name: checkAdmin
params.description:
Whether having the {@link PermissionFlagsBits.Administrator} permission
will return all permissions

methods.name: rolePermissions
methods.description: Gets the overall set of permissions for a role in this channel, taking into account channel overwrites.

params.name: role
params.description: The role to obtain the overall permissions for

params.name: checkAdmin
params.description:
Whether having the {@link PermissionFlagsBits.Administrator} permission
will return all permissions

methods.name: lockPermissions
methods.description: Locks in the permission overwrites from the parent channel.

methods.description: Edits the channel.

params.name: options
params.description: The options to provide

methods.name: setName
methods.description: Sets a new name for the guild channel.

params.name: name
params.description: The new name for the guild channel

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for changing the guild channel's name

methods.name: setParent
methods.description: Sets the parent of this channel.

params.name: channel
params.description: The category channel to set as the parent

params.name: options
params.description: The options for setting the parent

methods.name: setPosition
methods.description: Sets a new position for the guild channel.

params.name: position
params.description: The new position for the guild channel

params.name: options
params.description: Options for setting position

methods.name: clone
methods.description: Clones this channel.

params.name: options
params.description: The options for cloning this channel

methods.name: equals
methods.description:
Checks if this channel has the same type, topic, position, name, overwrites, and id as another channel.
In most cases, a simple `channel.id === channel2.id` will do, and is much faster too.

params.name: channel
params.description: Channel to compare with

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes this channel.

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for deleting this channel

methods.name: toString
methods.description: When concatenated with a string, this automatically returns the channel's mention instead of the Channel object.
examples:
// Logs: Hello from <#123456789012345678>!
console.log(`Hello from ${channel}!`);

methods.name: fetch
methods.description: Fetches this channel.

params.name: force
params.description: Whether to skip the cache check and request the API

methods.name: isThread
methods.description: Indicates whether this channel is a {@link ThreadChannel}.

methods.name: isTextBased
methods.description: Indicates whether this channel is {@link TextBasedChannels text-based}.

methods.name: isDMBased
methods.description: Indicates whether this channel is DM-based (either a {@link DMChannel} or a {@link PartialGroupDMChannel}).

methods.name: isVoiceBased
methods.description: Indicates whether this channel is {@link BaseGuildVoiceChannel voice-based}.

methods.name: isThreadOnly
methods.description: Indicates whether this channel is {@link ThreadOnlyChannel thread-only}.

classes.name: VoiceState
classes.description: Represents the voice state for a Guild Member.

props.name: guild
props.description: The guild of this voice state

props.name: id
props.description: The id of the member of this voice state

props.name: serverDeaf
props.description: Whether this member is deafened server-wide

props.name: serverMute
props.description: Whether this member is muted server-wide

props.name: selfDeaf
props.description: Whether this member is self-deafened

props.name: selfMute
props.description: Whether this member is self-muted

props.name: selfVideo
props.description: Whether this member's camera is enabled

props.name: sessionId
props.description: The session id for this member's connection

props.name: streaming
props.description: Whether this member is streaming using "Screen Share"

props.name: channelId
props.description: The {@link VoiceChannel} or {@link StageChannel} id the member is in

props.name: suppress
props.description: Whether this member is suppressed from speaking. This property is specific to stage channels only.

props.name: requestToSpeakTimestamp
props.description: The time at which the member requested to speak. This property is specific to stage channels only.

props.name: member
props.description: The member that this voice state belongs to

props.name: channel
props.description: The channel that the member is connected to

props.name: deaf
props.description: Whether this member is either self-deafened or server-deafened

props.name: mute
props.description: Whether this member is either self-muted or server-muted

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated this

methods.name: setMute
methods.description: Mutes/unmutes the member of this voice state.

params.name: mute
params.description: Whether or not the member should be muted

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for muting or unmuting

methods.name: setDeaf
methods.description: Deafens/undeafens the member of this voice state.

params.name: deaf
params.description: Whether or not the member should be deafened

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for deafening or undeafening

methods.name: disconnect
methods.description: Disconnects the member from the channel.

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for disconnecting the member from the channel

methods.name: setChannel
methods.description: Moves the member to a different channel, or disconnects them from the one they're in.

params.name: channel
params.description:
Channel to move the member to, or `null` if you want to
disconnect them from voice.

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for moving member to another channel or disconnecting

methods.name: edit
methods.description: Edits this voice state. Currently only available when in a stage channel

params.name: options
params.description: The options to provide

methods.name: fetch
methods.description: Fetches this voice state.

params.name: force
params.description: Whether to skip the cache check and request the API

methods.name: setRequestToSpeak
methods.description:
Toggles the request to speak in the channel.
Only applicable for stage channels and for the client's own voice state.
examples:
// Making the client request to speak in a stage channel (raise its hand)
guild.members.me.voice.setRequestToSpeak(true);

// Making the client cancel a request to speak
guild.members.me.voice.setRequestToSpeak(false);

params.name: requestToSpeak
params.description: Whether or not the client is requesting to become a speaker.

methods.name: setSuppressed
methods.description: Suppress/unsuppress the user. Only applicable for stage channels.
examples:
// Making the client a speaker
guild.members.me.voice.setSuppressed(false);

// Making the client an audience member
guild.members.me.voice.setSuppressed(true);

// Inviting another user to speak
voiceState.setSuppressed(false);

// Moving another user to the audience, or cancelling their invite to speak
voiceState.setSuppressed(true);

params.name: suppressed
params.description: Whether or not the user should be suppressed.
